record.description: Uranus and its system of five known moons. The photograph, taken March 1, 1948 with the 82-inch McDonald Reflector at an exposure of 3.5 minutes, is interesting because of the Vth satellite, a minute object within the Halation Ring. The satellite's apparent magnitude is 17, period about 34 hours, and mean distance from Uranus 81,000 miles. Dr. Gerard Kuiper discovered the moon on an photograph he took February 15, 1948 through the same telescope. The fifth moon is named Miranda; the four others shown are Ariel, Umbriel, Titania, and Oberon.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Curling at the edges.Caption is scanned in as part of the original photograph.
